intro: Croton siraki, commonly known as the red croton, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, brightly colored leaves that range from red to orange and yellow. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and economically important species. Croton siraki typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and landscape design.
